931.text: Poland said on Friday that Swiss bank accounts , which in many cases belonged to Polish Jews who died in the Holocaust , were used in debt settlements between the two countries after the World War Two .

932.text: Foreign Minister Dariusz Rosati , unveiling first findings of a special government commission , said that in 1970s the then communist Poland received 460,000 Swiss francs from the accounts .

933.text: " In 1970s , Poland received from unclaimed accounts in Switzerland a sum of 460,000 francs .

935.text: Switzerland stands accused by Senator Alfonse D'Amato , chairman of the powerful U.S. Senate Banking Committee , of agreeing to give money to Poland from unclaimed bank accounts of Polish citizens , as part of an accord on compensating Swiss nationals whose assets had been seized in communist Poland .

936.text: Many of these citizens were Jews murdered during the war , when Nazi German invaders killed most of Poland 's 3.5 million Jews .

937.text: Rosati did not say whether the payment in 1970s was part of the 1949 agreement between Warsaw and Switzerland on compensation to Swiss citizens whose assets were seized by the Soviet - imposed communists authorities after World War Two .

939.text: Rosati confirmed that the 1949 agreement had provided for granting Switzerland about 53 million francs and most of this sum was repaid with coal exports .

940.text: He said , however , that Switzerland did get about 16,000 francs from the so - called " dead accounts " as part of the compensation .

941.text: " About 16,000 francs were seized from accounts of four or five Polish citizens , whose data we do not precisely know .

942.text: The issue is of moral and legal nature , because its financial significance is small , " Rosati said .

1874.text: EU , Poland agree on oil import tariffs .

1876.text: The European Union and Poland have resolved disagreements over a new Polish oil import regime , the European Commission said on Friday .

1877.text: The EU had objected to increases in Polish tariffs on imports of gasoline and gasoil products introduced on January 1 , 1996 , saying they contravened levels envisaged in the so - called Europe Agreement between the EU and Poland .

1878.text: The increases were aimed at protecting the Polish market while helping to modernise the local oil industry .

1879.text: " The EU and Poland have now reached a final settlement regarding issues related to the Polish import regime in the oils sector , " the Commission said in a statement .

1880.text: Under the agreement , Poland will abolish all oil import tariffs by 2001 , remove all oil price controls and end quantitative restrictions on imports by January 1 , 1997 .

1881.text: The agreement includes the early privatisation and modernisation of Polish oil refineries , which will be obliged to offer equal treatment to all buyers .

1882.text: The EU and Poland will monitor the settlement at six - monthly meetings .

2595.text: Brian Shimer piloted USA III to a surprise victory in a World Cup two - man bobsleigh race on Saturday .

2596.text: Lying fifth after the first run , Shimer and breakman Randy Jones delivered a near - perfect second trip down the 1976 Olympic course for an aggregate time of one minute 45.91 seconds .

2597.text: First run leaders Guenther Huber and breakman Antonio Tartaglia in the Italy I sleigh finished second two - hundredths of a second behind the Americans .

2598.text: Canada I , represented by Pierre Lueders and breakman Dave MacEachern , completed the third World cup event of the winter a further one - hundredth of a second behind the Italians .

2599.text: The Canadians , winners of the opening two events in Altenberg , Germany , and La Plagne , France , increased their lead in the World Cup standings .

2601.text: SKIING - CHINESE MAKE PROMISING FREESTYLE SKIING DEBUT .

2603.text: China made a promising debut on the freestyle skiing world cup circuit in an aerials event in the French resort of Tignes on Saturday .

2604.text: While the Chinese failed to gain a place in the men 's final , they had two in the top 10 of the women 's competition , Cuo Dan finishing a respectable seventh and Xu Nannan ninth .

2605.text: But overall , it was France and Canada who dominated the day .

2606.text: Alexis Blanc and Sebastien Foucras gave France a one - two finish in the first aerials competition of the season .

2607.text: Blanc collected his seventh career World Cup win with a two jump combined score of 238.36 points , easily beating Foucras , the overall World Cup aerials champion , who was a distant second with 223.60 .

2608.text: Canada 's Jeff Bean , who had never finished higher than ninth in a World Cup event , made his first trip to the podium taking third place with a mark of 209.96 .

2609.text: Veronica Brenner of Canada , who picked up her first career victory at Tignes last year , made it two wins in a row at the French resort taking first in the women 's competition with a score of 170.42 .

2610.text: Swiss skiers occupied the other two places on the podium , Karin Kuster taking second with 160.55 narrowly ahead of Evelyne Leu with 160.36 .

2637.text: CRICKET - WOOLMER MAKES SENTIMENTAL RETURN TO KANPUR .

2639.text: South Africa 's trip to Kanpur for the third test against India has given former England test cricketer Bob Woolmer the chance of a sentimental return to his birthplace .

2640.text: Woolmer was born in the northern city of Kanpur when his father worked there for an insurance compnay and was himself an active cricketer .

2642.text: A visit to India is always an intriguing experience , " Woolmer , now the South African coach , said on Saturday .

2643.text: Woolmer , 48 , played 19 tests for England between 1975 and 1981 .

2644.text: His first cricketing sojurn to India was as a member of Tony Greig 's England side in 1976 - 77 .

2645.text: His father Clarence Woolmer represented United Province , now renamed Uttar Pradesh , in India 's Ranji Trophy national championship and captained the state during 1949 .

2646.text: Now aged 86 , Woolmer senior lives with his son in Cape Town .

2647.text: Woolmer 's memories of Kanpur are few and blurred .

2649.text: I came here on zero and left at three ( aged three ) when my father was transferred to Calcutta where I spent another four and half years .

2652.text: Woolmer said the hospital where he was born is close to the stadium where the India - South Africa test will be played .

2763.text: ALPINE SKIING - OFFICIALS HOPE TO SALVAGE WORLD CUP WEEKEND .

2765.text: World Cup ski officials hope to be able to get in at least one men 's downhill training run on Saturday in an effort to salvage the weekend racing programme .

2766.text: For the third consecutive day , Friday 's scheduled training runs were cancelled due to heavy wet snow and fog on Whistler Mountain , leaving the scheduled World Cup events in jeopardy .

2767.text: Rules call for at least one training run to be completed before a World Cup downhill race can be staged .

2768.text: Organisers hope to get that run in on Saturday morning , conditions permitting , and stage the race later in the day or on Sunday .

2769.text: " There was no possibility today to make a training run , " said Bernd Zobel , the Canadian men 's national coach , citing too much new snow and poor visibility .

2770.text: If organisers are forced to run the downhill on Sunday , the super - giant slalom originally scheduled for Sunday would likely be abandoned .

3186.text: SOCCER - SOUTH KOREA MOVE CLOSE TO QUARTER - FINAL BERTH .

3188.text: South Korea made virtually certain of an Asian Cup quarter - final spot with a 4 - 2 win over Indonesia in a Group A match on Saturday .

3189.text: After going four up in the first 55 minutes South Korea allowed Indonesia , newcomers to Asian Cup finals , back into the match , conceding two goals from rare counter attacks .

3190.text: Kim Do Hoon opened the scoring for South Korea in only the fifth minute , turning unmarked on the penalty spot to fire a shot into the top corner .

3191.text: It looked like turning into a rout as Hwang Sun Hong rapidly added two more in the seventh and 15th minutes but although the Koreans continued to dominate they failed to add to the score before the interval .

3192.text: But they started the second half where they had left off and it was not long before they went four up , Ko Jeong Woon heading in from a free kick in the 55th minute .

3193.text: The Koreans then appeared to relax , allowing the Indonesians to get back into the match .

3194.text: Ronny Wabia scored for Indonesia three minutes later direct from a a corner kick that Korean goalkeeper Kim Byung reached with one hand but failed to keep out .

3195.text: With 65 minutes gone Indonesia 's Widodo Putra , who scored a spectacular goal against Kuwait on Wednesday , was again on target , breaking through the Korean defence to beat the keeper with a low shot .

3196.text: Indonesian keeper Hendro Kartiko produced a string of fine saves to prevent the Koreans increasing their lead .

3442.text: SOCCER - ENGLISHMAN CHARLTON IS MADE AN HONORARY IRISHMAN .

3445.text: Charlton , 61 , and his wife , Peggy , became citizens of Ireland when they formally received Irish passports from deputy Prime Minister Dick Spring who said the honour had been made in recognition of Charlton 's achievements as the national soccer manager .

3446.text: " The years I spent as manager of the Republic of Ireland were the best years of my life .

3447.text: It all culminated in the fact that I now have lots of great , great friends in Ireland .

3450.text: Charlton managed Ireland for 93 matches , during which time they lost only 17 times in almost 10 years until he resigned in December 1995 .

3451.text: He guided Ireland to two successive World Cup finals tournaments and to the 1988 European championship finals in Germany , after the Irish beat a well - fancied England team 1 - 0 in their group qualifier .

3452.text: The lanky former Leeds United defender did not make his England debut until the age of 30 but eventually won 35 caps and was a key member of the 1966 World Cup winning team with his younger brother , Bobby .
